original: pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya
translated: … at the mind-consciousness element …🔽… at the mind-consciousness-contact element …🔽… at the three kinds of feelings that arise with mind-contact as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of craving that arise with feeling as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of clinging that arise with craving as condition …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Naadhipatyādi
analyzed: ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  na adhipati ādi
translated: … at existence that arises with clinging as condition …🔽… at birth that arises with existence as condition …🔽… at ageing and death that arises with birth as condition …🔽… at the six sense spheres that arise with name-and-form as condition …

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: … at contact that arises with the six sense spheres as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of feeling that arise with contact as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of craving that arise with feeling as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of clinging that arise with craving as condition …🔽… at existence that arises with clinging as condition …🔽… at birth that arises with existence as condition …🔽… at ageing and death that arises with birth as condition …

original: … napurejātapaccayā … napacchājātapaccayā … naāsevanapaccayā … nakammapaccayā … navipākapaccayā🔽… —nevadassanena nabhāvanāya …pe… najhānapaccayā—pañcaviññāṇaṁ …pe… namaggapaccayā—
analyzed: na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā  na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pe na jhāna paccayā pañca viññāṇam pe na magga paccayā
translated: … at the six sense spheres that arise with name-and-form as condition …🔽… at contact that arises with the six sense spheres as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of feeling that arise with contact as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of craving that arise with feeling as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of clinging that arise with craving as condition …🔽… at existence that arises with clinging as condition …

original: ahetukaṁ …pe… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo …pe… navippayuttapaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: ahetukam pe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ pe na vippayutta paccayā tīṇi
translated: … at birth that arises with existence as condition …🔽… at ageing and death that arises with birth as condition …🔽… at the six sense spheres that arise with name-and-form as condition …

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: … at contact that arises with the six sense spheres as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of feeling that arise with contact as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of craving that arise with feeling as condition …🔽… at the three kinds of clinging that arise with craving as condition …🔽… at existence that arises with clinging as condition …🔽… at birth that arises with existence as condition …🔽… at ageing and death that arises with birth as condition …🔽… at the six sense spheres that arise with name-and-form as condition …🔽… at contact that arises with the six sense spheres as condition …

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: … at the three kinds of feeling that arise with contact as condition

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to not as root cause, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as predominance, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as prior, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as subsequent, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as nutriment, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for kamma, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for result, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for jhāna, there is one line of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for path, there is one line of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for non-causality, there are three lines of reasoning.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.🔽1.9.5.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya  paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.🔽.... The reverse order of conditions in forward order

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.🔽Anulomapaccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi  anuloma paccanīya
translated: With respect to root cause as condition, there are three lines of reasoning with respect to not as predominance. With respect to not as prior, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as subsequent, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as nutriment, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for kamma, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for result, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as a condition for non-causality, there are three lines of reasoning.

original: 1.9.5.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe🔽tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme tīṇi, vipāke🔽ekaṁ, āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge dve, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma  na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte tīṇi aññamaññe  tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme tīṇi vipāke  eka āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge dve sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte
translated: The forward order of conditions in reverse order

original: tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to not as root cause, there are three lines of reasoning with respect to object. With respect to not as proximity, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as contiguity, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as arising together, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as conascence, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as dependence, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as decisive support, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as prior, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as nutriment, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as kamma, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as result, there is one line of reasoning. With respect to not as nutriment, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as faculty, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to not as jhāna

original: Paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya anuloma
translated: In the reverse order.🔽🔽

original: Saṁsaṭṭhavāro.
analyzed: sa saṭṭhavāraḥ
translated: In reverse order.🔽The section on association.

original: 1.9.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: The section on related🔽…

original: 1.9.6.1–4. Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: The section on conditions in direct order, etc.

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ sampayutto dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sampayuttavāro saṁsaṭṭhavārasadiso.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sampayuttaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sampayutta vāraḥ sa saṭṭha vāra sadiso
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is related to a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing as a condition by way of root condition. (The section on relatedness is similar to the section on association.)

original: 1.9.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: … The section on questions🔽… The section on conditions in direct order

original: 1.9.7.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on analysis

original: Hetu🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo dassanena pahātabbāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayo  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ dassanena pahātabbāḥ hetū citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Root cause🔽A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition by way of root cause condition for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. The root causes that are to be given up by seeing are a condition by way of root cause condition for the associated aggregates.🔽A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition by way of root cause condition for a phenomenon that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development. The root causes that are to be given up by seeing are a condition by way of root cause condition for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition by way of root cause condition for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing and for a phenomenon that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development.

original: ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccaya udassanena pahātabbāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates.🔽A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo …pe… dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa …pe… bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ pe dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa pe bhāvanāya pahātabbāḥ hetū citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is not to be given up by seeing or by development …

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽ca dhammassa …pe… bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  ca dhammassa pe bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽dhammassa …pe… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe nevadassanena
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  dhammassa pe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam  citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe na iva dassanena
translated: A state that is to be given up neither through vision nor through development is related to a state that is to be given up neither through vision nor through development as a condition by way of the condition being a condition by way of object condition.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, states that are to be given up neither through vision nor through development are related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality that originate together with consciousness as a condition by way of the condition being a condition by way of object condition.

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dassanena🔽pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: ārammaṇa  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayodassanena  pahātabbam rāgam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: Object Condition🔽A state that is to be given up through vision is related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition by way of object condition: One approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to a state that is to be given up through vision. In dependence on that, greed that is to be given up through vision arises.

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati. Dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati
translated: A view that is to be given up through vision arises. Uncertainty that is to be given up through vision arises. Sorrow that is to be given up through vision arises.

original: diṭṭhiṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi🔽uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati. Dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati, vicikicchaṁ
analyzed: diṭṭhim assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi  uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati vicikiccha
translated: He approves of and delights in that view. Lust is produced in him in regard to that view.🔽A view is produced in him in regard to that view. Uncertainty is produced in him in regard to that view.🔽Gloom is produced in him in regard to that view. Uncertainty is produced in him in regard to uncertainty.

original: ārabbha vicikicchā uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: ārabbha vicikicchā uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati  dassanena pahātabbam domanassam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati
translated: A view is produced in him in regard to uncertainty. Gloom is produced in him in regard to uncertainty.🔽Gloom is produced in him in regard to gloom.

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati.
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati
translated: A view is produced in him in regard to gloom. Uncertainty is produced in him in regard to gloom.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo—ariyā dassanena pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti, pubbe samudāciṇṇe
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayoariyāḥ dassanena pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti pubbe samudāciṇṇe
translated: A state that should be abandoned by seeing is related to a state that should not be abandoned by seeing as object condition.

original: kilese jānanti. Dassanena pahātabbe khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti.
analyzed: kilese jānanti dassanena pahātabbe khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti
translated: Noble disciples review defilements that have been abandoned by seeing as having been abandoned by seeing. They understand defilements that have been abandoned by seeing in the past as having been abandoned by seeing. They contemplate the impermanence, the change, the fading away, and the cessation of the aggregates that should be abandoned by seeing.

original: Cetopariyañāṇena dassanena pahātabbacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānanti. Dassanena pahātabbā
analyzed: cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena dassanena pahātabba citta samaṅgissa cittam jānanti dassanena pahātabbā
translated: By means of the knowledge of penetration of minds they know the mind of one who is possessed of a mind that can be ended by seeing.🔽The aggregates that can be ended by seeing

original: khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa,
analyzed: khandhā cetas upariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa
translated: are a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of penetration of minds, for the knowledge of recollection of past lives, for the knowledge of faring according to deeds, for knowledge of the future,

original: āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: for adverting.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya🔽pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya  pahātabbam rāgam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: A state that can be ended by development is a condition, as object condition, for a state that can be ended by development:🔽one approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to the greed that can be ended by development. Because of that, greed that can be ended by development arises,

original: uddhaccaṁ uppajjati. Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ ārabbha
analyzed: uddhaccam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati uddhaccam ārabbha
translated: agitation arises. One approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to the grief that can be ended by development. Because of that,🔽agitation arises. One approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to the grief that can be ended by development. Because of that,

original: uddhaccaṁ uppajjati. Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati, bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ🔽domanassaṁ ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: uddhaccam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabba 🔽domanassam ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati
translated: grief that can be ended by development arises, agitation arises.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya🔽pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya  pahātabbam rāgam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by development is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing …🔽He delights in and enjoys the greed that is to be given up by development, and on that account greed that is to be given up by seeing arises in him.

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati, dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati.🔽Uddhaccaṁ ārabbha diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati, dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati  uddhaccam ārabbha diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassa
translated: A view … Uncertainty … The distress that is to be given up by seeing arises.🔽Uncertainty … The distress that is to be given up by seeing arises.

original: uppajjati. Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbam domanassa
translated: He delights in and enjoys the distress that is to be given up by development, and on that account the distress that is to be given up by seeing arises in him.

original: uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati.
analyzed: uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati
translated: A view … Uncertainty … The distress that is to be given up by seeing arises.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by development is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development …

original: paccayo—ariyā bhāvanāya pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti, vikkhambhite kilese
analyzed: paccayoariyāḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti vikkhambhite kilese
translated: Noble disciples review defilements that are to be given up by development as given up, and the fetters that are to be abandoned …

original: paccavekkhanti, pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānanti. Bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe aniccato🔽dukkhato anattato vipassanti, cetopariyañāṇena bhāvanāya pahātabbacittasamaṅgissa🔽cittaṁ jānanti. Bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,🔽yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccavekkhanti pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānanti bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe aniccato  dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena bhāvanāya pahātabba citta samaṅgissa  cittam jānanti bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa  yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: they review the defilements that have been formerly abandoned. The aggregates that are to be abandoned by development are seen as impermanent,

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: as painful, as not self. The knowledge of penetration of minds knows the minds of those possessed of the aggregates that are to be abandoned by development. The aggregates that are to be abandoned by development are a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of penetration of minds, for knowledge of recollection of past lives,

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ🔽katvā taṁ paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati, jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ🔽paccavekkhati. Ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti, phalaṁ paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kamma 🔽katvā tam paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhāna 🔽paccavekkhati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti phalam paccavekkhanti
translated: for knowledge of faring on in accordance with kamma, for knowledge of the future, and for adverting.

original: nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti; nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa, āvajjanāya🔽ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Cakkhuṁ aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati; sotaṁ …
analyzed: nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa āvajjanāya  ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati sotam
translated: they reflect on Nibbāna. Nibbāna is related to the change-of-lineage, to the penetration, to the path, to the fruition, to the adverting

original: ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ … rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … nevadassanena🔽nabhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati; dibbena cakkhunā
analyzed: ghānam jivham kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum na iva dassanena  na bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati dibbena cakkhunā
translated: It is a condition, as object condition, for the eye … for the ear … for the nose … for the tongue … for the body … for forms … for sounds … for odours … for flavours … for tangible data … for the physical basis … for the states that are neither directly visible nor to be directly known.🔽It is a condition, as object condition, for the aggregates that are to be abandoned by the vision of the first path, for the aggregates that are to be abandoned by the vision of the higher paths, for the aggregates that are to be abandoned by cultivation, for the aggregates that are not to be abandoned.

original: rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena nevadassanena
analyzed: rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena na iva dassanena
translated: It is a condition, as object condition, for the visible forms that are seen with the divine eye, for the sounds that are heard with the divine ear.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānanti, ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanassa
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabba citta samaṅgissa cittam jānanti ākāsānañcāyatanam viññāṇañcāyatanassa
translated: It is a condition, as object condition, for the cognizance of one who has the aggregates that are to be abandoned by the vision of the first path, etc., for the cognizance of one who has the aggregates that are not to be abandoned.

original: …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa …pe… rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: pe ākiñcañña āyatanam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa pe rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: It is a condition, as object condition, for the base consisting of boundless space for the base consisting of boundless consciousness … for the base consisting of nothingness for the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception … for the eye faculty for eye-consciousness …🔽It is a condition, as object condition, for the body faculty for body-consciousness …

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: It is a condition, as object condition, for the tangible-data base for body-consciousness …

original: paccayo …pe… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,🔽pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa  pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa yathākammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is not to be given up by seeing or by developing is a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of the mind-made body, for the knowledge of the future, for the knowledge of the recollection of past lives, for the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance, for adverting.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ assādeti abhinandati,🔽taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati,
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccaya udānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam assādeti abhinandati  tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati
translated: A state that is not to be given up by seeing or by developing is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing …🔽Giving a gift, undertaking precepts, performing the Uposatha ceremony, and being intent on that are a condition, as object condition, for greed that is to be given up by seeing, for a view that is to be given up by seeing, for doubt that is to be given up by seeing,

original: dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati. Pubbe suciṇṇāni assādeti abhinandati …pe…
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni assādeti abhinandati pe
translated: for sorrow that is to be given up by seeing. Being intent on past actions that have been done and on past vows that have been made …

original: jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo
analyzed: jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ
translated: Emerging from jhāna and being intent on the jhāna are a condition, as object condition, for greed that is to be given up by seeing,

original: …pe… diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… jhāne parihīne vippaṭisārissa dassanena pahātabbaṁ🔽domanassaṁ uppajjati. Cakkhuṁ assādeti abhinandati …pe… sotaṁ … ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ …🔽kāyaṁ … rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … nevadassanena nabhāvanāya
analyzed: pe diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe jhāne parihīne vippaṭisārissa dassanena pahātabba  domanassam uppajjati cakkhum assādeti abhinandati pe sotam ghānam jivham  kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya
translated: … view … uncertainty … remorse that has arisen in one who has fallen away from jhāna is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽He delights in and enjoys the eye … the ear … the nose … the tongue …

original: pahātabbe khandhe assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo …pe…
analyzed: pahātabbe khandhe assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ pe
translated: the body … visible objects … sounds … smells … tastes … tactile objects … the physical basis … He delights in and enjoys the aggregates that are to be abandoned by seeing. Craving …

original: diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati
translated: view … uncertainty … remorse that is to be abandoned by seeing arises in dependence on that.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation is related to a state that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation as object condition.

original: paccayo—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: paccaya udānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam assādeti abhinandati
translated: Having given a gift, having undertaken the precepts, having done a meditation exercise, he delights in and enjoys that.

original: taṁ ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ uppajjati, bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: tam ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabba
translated: Craving … agitation … remorse that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation arises in dependence on that.

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati. Pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe assādeti …pe… taṁ ārabbha bhāvanāya🔽pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ uppajjati, bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā pe cakkhum pe vatthu  na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe assādeti pe tam ārabbha bhāvanāya  pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati
translated: When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.

original: Adhipati🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: adhipati  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dassanena pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti🔽abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati;
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dassanena pahātabbam rāgam garum katvā assādeti  abhinandati tam garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.

original: diṭṭhiṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo
analyzed: diṭṭhim garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ
translated: When he has emerged from the jhānas, he recollects the virtues of the Buddhas, etc., and he recollects his own virtues.🔽When he has emerged from the jhānas, he

original: uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabbā adhipati sampayuttakāna
translated: a view arises. As co-nascent and dominant condition, the dominant condition that is to be abandoned by seeing, for what is associated with it,

original: khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and view. Conascence-predominance: A state that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as predominance condition, for associated states.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: A state that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by development.

original: paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabba adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence-predominance: A state that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as predominance condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabba adhipati
translated: A state that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is to be abandoned by seeing and for a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by development.

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence-predominance: A state that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A state that is to be abandoned by development is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is to be abandoned by development. As object-predominance,

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati bhāvanāya pahātabbam rāgam garum katvā assādeti
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, predominance condition as object and predominance condition as co-nascence.🔽Predominance condition as object: Having made great the greed to be given up by the path of cultivation one delights in it

original: abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—bhāvanāya
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati sahajāta adhipati bhāvanāya
translated: and enjoys it. Having made that great the greed to be given up by the path of cultivation arises.

original: pahātabbādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pahātabba adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Predominance condition as co-nascence: The predominance condition as co-nascence of the states to be given up by the path of cultivation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state to be given up by the path of cultivation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state to be given up by the path of seeing.

original: Ārammaṇādhipati—bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati bhāvanāya pahātabbam rāgam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: Predominance condition as object: Having made great the greed to be given up by the path of cultivation one delights in it and enjoys it.

original: garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati  bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: Having made that great the greed to be given up by the path of seeing arises, and views arise.🔽A state to be given up by the path of cultivation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state not to be given up by either the path of seeing or the path of cultivation.

original: paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—bhāvanāya pahātabbādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati bhāvanāya pahātabba adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Predominance condition as co-nascence: The predominance condition as co-nascence of the states to be given up by the path of cultivation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the forms that are mind-made.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is to be given up by development and for a state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development.

original: ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—bhāvanāya pahātabbādhipati🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati bhāvanāya pahātabba adhipati  sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence as dominant condition: a state that is to be given up by development as dominant condition for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of the elements.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ🔽datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, pubbe🔽suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dāna  datvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam garum katvā paccavekkhati pubbe  su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam garum katvā paccavekkhati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: A state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development.🔽As object dominant condition: having given a gift, having undertaken moral discipline, having performed the duties of the Uposatha, he reviews that as lofty. Having given a gift … etc. …

original: maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, phalaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ garuṁ
analyzed: maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti phalam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam garu
translated: Having performed the duties of the Uposatha, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour from someone, he reviews that as lofty. Having done a favour for someone, having received a favour

original: katvā paccavekkhanti; nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati nā iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba adhipati sampayuttakāna
translated: Having done so, they review it. The unformed element is related to the penetration of the taintless will-to-remission, to the path, and to the fruition, as decisive-support condition.🔽Conascence-predominance: the unformed element is related to the aggregates associated with it and to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as decisive-support condition.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: The unformed element is related to states to be abandoned by seeing as decisive-support condition.

original: paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati dānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam garu
translated: Object-predominance: having given a gift, undertaken a moral practice, performed an offering, observed the Uposatha, having done these things, he respects and reveres, esteems and venerates, them, and lust, view,🔽and conceit based on that, which are to be abandoned by seeing, arise. Having remembered the virtues of the Enlightened One, of the True Idea, of the Sangha, and of virtue, and having remembered the will-to-remission, the path, and the fruition, he respects and reveres, esteems and venerates, them, and lust, view,

original: katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi🔽uppajjati. Pubbe suciṇṇāni garuṁ katvā …pe… jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā
analyzed: katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi  uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni garum katvā pe jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam garum katvā
translated: and conceit based on that, which are to be abandoned by seeing, arise. Having emerged from the jhanas, he respects and reveres, esteems and venerates, the jhana, and lust, view,🔽and conceit based on that, which are to be abandoned by seeing, arise. Having remembered the virtues of the Enlightened One, of the True Idea, of the Sangha, and of virtue, and having remembered the will-to-remission, the path, and the fruition, he respects and reveres, esteems and venerates, them, and lust, view,

original: …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ … nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe garuṁ katvā
analyzed: pe cakkhum pe vatthum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe garum katvā
translated: and conceit based on that, which are to be abandoned by seeing, arise. Having remembered the virtues of the Enlightened One, of the True Idea, of the Sangha, and of virtue, and having remembered the will-to-remission, the path, and the fruition, he respects and reveres, esteems and venerates, the aggregates that are not to be abandoned by either seeing or by keeping-in-being, and lust, view,🔽and conceit based on that, which are to be abandoned by seeing, arise.

original: assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: Delight arises and he welcomes and relishes those feelings and cleaves to them. Lust arises that should be abandoned by seeing. A view arises.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati dānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam garu
translated: A state that should be abandoned neither by seeing nor by development is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that should be abandoned by development.

original: katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati. Pubbe🔽…pe… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati pubbe  pe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbe khandhe garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: Predominance as object: having given a gift, having undertaken the precepts, having done the duties connected with the Uposatha, he delights in and welcomes those things and cleaves to them. Lust arises that should be abandoned by development. Having done this or that meritorious deed…

original: taṁ garuṁ katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati.
analyzed: tam garum katvā bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: having done this or that non- meritorious deed, he delights in and welcomes those things and cleaves to them. Lust arises that should be abandoned by development.

original: Anantara🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā
analyzed: anantara  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā
translated: Succession🔽A state that should be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as proximity condition, for a state that should be abandoned by seeing. Preceding…

original: purimā dassanena pahātabbā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ dassanena pahātabbānaṁ
analyzed: purimāḥ dassanena pahātabbā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam dassanena pahātabbāna
translated: preceding aggregates are a condition, as proximity condition, for succeeding aggregates that should be abandoned by seeing.

original: khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā khandhā vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā
analyzed: khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo dassanena pahātabbāḥ khandhāḥ vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayo  bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā
translated: is a condition, as proximate condition, for the aggregates.🔽A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not to be given up by either seeing or by cultivation—the aggregates that are to be given up by seeing are a condition, as proximate condition, for emergence.

original: purimā bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhā vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purimāḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbā khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam bhāvanāya pahātabbāna  khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbāḥ khandhāḥ vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up by cultivation is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is to be given up by cultivation—the earlier aggregates that are to be given up by cultivation are a condition, as proximate condition, for the later aggregates that are to be given up by cultivation.🔽A state that is to be given up by cultivation is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not to be given up by either seeing or by cultivation—the aggregates that are to be given up by cultivation are a condition, as proximate condition, for emergence.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: A state that is not to be given up by either seeing or by cultivation is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not to be given up by either seeing or by cultivation—

original: dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbā🔽khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā  khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbānam khandhānam
translated: The preceding and subsequent aggregates that are to be abandoned by neither-seeing-nor-developing are related to the subsequent aggregates that are to be abandoned by neither-seeing-nor-developing as an immediately preceding condition.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo. Anulomaṁ gotrabhussa … anulomaṁ vodānassa … gotrabhu maggassa
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa anulomam vodānassa gotrabhu maggassa
translated: The preceding and subsequent aggregates that are to be abandoned by neither-seeing-nor-developing are related to the path that is to be developed as an immediately preceding condition.🔽The path that is to be developed is related to the fruition that is to be attained as an immediately preceding condition.🔽The fruition that is to be attained is related to the fruition that is to be attained as an immediately preceding condition.

original: … vodānaṁ maggassa … maggo phalassa … phalaṁ phalassa … anulomaṁ phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: vodānam maggassa  maggaḥ phalassa phalam phalassa anulomam phala samāpattiyā
translated: The path that is to be developed is related to the attainment of fruition as an immediately preceding condition.🔽The attainment of fruition is related to the attainment of fruition as an immediately preceding condition.

original: … nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: nirodhāt vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: The attainment of fruition is related to the emergence from the attainment of cessation as an immediately preceding condition.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa …pe… āvajjanā dassanena pahātabbānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa pe āvajjanā dassanena pahātabbānaṃ khandhānaṃ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be abandoned by neither-seeing-nor-developing is related to a state that is to be abandoned by seeing as an immediately preceding condition.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—āvajjanā bhāvanāya pahātabbānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā bhāvanāya pahātabbānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing is not a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is to be given up by development.

original: Samanantara
analyzed: samanantara
translated: Contiguity

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa samanantarapaccayena paccayo. (Anantarasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ anantara sadisa
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as contiguity condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing. (As for the rest, it is similar to the section on proximity.)

original: Sahajāta🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: sahajāta  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Conascence🔽A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as conascence condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing … for three.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa … tīṇi.🔽Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa tīṇi  na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: A state that is to be given up by development is a condition, as conascence condition, for a state that is to be given up by development … for three.

original: dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo eko khandho
analyzed: dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development is a condition, as conascence condition, for a state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development. One aggregate is a condition, as conascence condition, for three aggregates and for materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: The three constituents and the form that is derived from the mind are a condition, by way of arising together condition, for the mind element and the mind-consciousness element.

original: dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… khandhā vatthussa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Vatthu khandhānaṁ …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ tiṇṇannaṁ mahābhūtānaṁ …pe… mahābhūtā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽rūpānaṁ …pe… bāhiraṁ … āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ … asaññasattānaṁ …pe….🔽Dassanena pahātabbo ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā nevadassanena🔽nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo— dassanena pahātabbā
analyzed: dve khandhā pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe khandhā vatthussa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  vatthu khandhānam pe ekam mahābhūtam tiṇṇannam mahābhūtānam pe mahābhūtā citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ  rūpānam pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam pe  dassanena pahātabbo ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā na iva dassanena  na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ dassanena pahātabbā
translated: The two constituents are a condition, by way of arising together condition, for the mental factors that are not associated with consciousness. At the time of rebirth-linking … The constituents are a condition, by way of arising together condition, for the physical basis.

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā nevadassanena

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo— bhāvanāya pahātabbā
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbā
translated: A factor that should be abandoned by vision is a condition, as conascence condition, for a factor that should be abandoned by vision.

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The aggregates that should be abandoned by vision and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality derived by clinging.

original: Aññamañña🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe….
analyzed: aññamañña  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe
translated: Mutuality🔽A factor that should be abandoned by vision is a condition, as mutuality condition, for a factor that should be abandoned by vision. A single aggregate is a condition, as mutuality condition, for three aggregates. …

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa …pe… bhāvanāya pahātabbo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe….🔽Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽dhammassa …pe… nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa pe bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe  na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  dhammassa pe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam
translated: A factor that should be abandoned by development is a condition, as mutuality condition, for a factor that should be abandoned by development. … A single aggregate is a condition, as mutuality condition, for three aggregates. …

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe nevadassanena nabhāvanāya
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya
translated: A factor that should be abandoned neither by vision nor by development is a condition, as mutuality condition, for a factor that should be abandoned neither by vision nor by development. … A single aggregate is a condition, as mutuality condition, for three aggregates. … Two aggregates are a condition, as mutuality condition, for two aggregates.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, a single aggregate is a condition, as mutuality condition, for three aggregates. … Two aggregates are a condition, as mutuality condition, for two aggregates.

original: pahātabbo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo🔽…pe… dve khandhā …pe… khandhā vatthussa …pe… vatthu khandhānaṁ …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ
analyzed: pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  pe dve khandhā pe khandhāḥ vatthussa pe vatthu khandhānam pe ekam mahābhūta
translated: One of the aggregates to be abandoned by vision is a condition, by way of mutual condition, for three of the aggregates and for the materiality of the physical basis.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ mahābhūtānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… asaññasattānaṁ …pe….
analyzed: tiṇṇannam mahābhūtānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe asaññasattānam pe
translated: … Two of the aggregates …pe… The aggregates are a condition, by way of mutual condition, for the physical basis. …pe… The physical basis is a condition, by way of mutual condition, for the aggregates. …pe… One of the great essentials is a condition, by way of mutual condition, for three of the great essentials. …pe… Beings without consciousness …pe…

original: Nissaya🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: nissaya  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Support🔽A state to be abandoned by vision is a condition, by way of support condition, for a state to be abandoned by vision … three.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa … tīṇi.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa tīṇi
translated: A state to be abandoned by development is a condition, by way of support condition, for a state to be abandoned by development … three.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa🔽dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo eko khandho
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa  dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A state not to be abandoned by vision or by development is a condition, by way of support condition, for a state not to be abandoned by vision or by development.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe

original: khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe….🔽Dassanena pahātabbo ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā nevadassanena
analyzed: khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe  dassanena pahātabbo ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā na iva dassanena
translated: The two aggregates are a condition, by way of support condition, for the two aggregates.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— dassanena pahātabbā
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ dassanena pahātabbā
translated: A factor that is to be abandoned by seeing and a factor that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation are a condition, by way of support condition, for a factor that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation.

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
analyzed: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā bhāvanāya pahātabbassa
translated: The aggregates that are to be abandoned by seeing and the great primaries are a condition, by way of support condition, for the form that is derived from the great primaries and is the mental factors.🔽A factor that is to be abandoned by cultivation and a factor that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation are a condition, by way of support condition, for a factor that is to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya pahātabbo eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ ca vatthu ca
translated: One aggregate that is to be abandoned by cultivation and the physical basis are a condition, by way of support condition, for three aggregates.

original: khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe….
analyzed: khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe
translated: Two aggregates that are to be abandoned by cultivation and the physical basis are a condition, by way of support condition, for two aggregates.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā nevadassanena
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā na iva dassanena
translated: A factor that is to be abandoned by cultivation and a factor that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation are a condition, by way of support condition, for a factor that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— bhāvanāya pahātabbā
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbā
translated: A condition being by way of prenascence condition for a phenomenon to be abandoned by vision is:

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The aggregates and the great primaries are a condition by way of prenascence condition for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Support

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo,🔽anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—dassanena pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ🔽upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati, adinnaṁ ādiyati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati. Dassanena pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo  anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ dassanena pahātabbam rāga  upanissāya pāṇam hanati adinnam ādiyati pe saṅgham bhindati dassanena pahātabba
translated: A phenomenon to be abandoned by vision is a support condition for a phenomenon to be abandoned by vision: as object support,

original: dosaṁ … mohaṁ … diṭṭhiṁ … patthanaṁ upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo rāgo … doso … moho … diṭṭhi … patthanā dassanena pahātabbassa
analyzed: dosam moham diṭṭhim patthanam upanissāya pāṇam hanati pe saṅgham bhindati  dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ diṭṭhi patthanā dassanena pahātabbassa
translated: as proximate support, as natural support. Natural support: Having made greed to be abandoned by vision a support, one kills a living creature, takes what is not given, … one breaks up the Community. Having made hate to be abandoned by vision … delusion … view … inconstancy to be abandoned by vision a support, one kills a living creature, … one breaks up the Community.

original: rāgassa … dosassa … mohassa … diṭṭhiyā … patthanāya upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rāgassa dosassa mohassa diṭṭhiyāḥ patthanāya upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Greed to be abandoned by vision … hate … delusion … view … inconstancy to be abandoned by vision is a support condition for greed to be abandoned by vision … for hate to be abandoned by vision … for delusion to be abandoned by vision … for view to be abandoned by vision … for inconstancy to be abandoned by vision.

With the divine eye one sees visible forms; with the divine ear element one hears sounds. The visible form base is a condition, as the object condition, for eye-consciousness and the qualities associated with it. The sound base … The odor base … The taste base … The tangible-object base … The mental-object base is a condition, as the object condition, for mind-consciousness and the qualities associated with it.
